name: katal
text: Only liberals like the Cure.

name: wehavemagnums
text: It's true

name: apocowarg
text: A comment left by apocowarg was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by patkun, implode, fakead, goocifer, mercuri0us, scrumpton, trisha, Sweetlips, yomimono, perhapsmaybe, Footbullet, kestral)

name: bjorntd
text: I read that comic too!

name: hawaiian_robot
text: I'm glad someone is speaking up against people just quoting previous comics (Ray Smuckles: He Gets Things Done was brilliant in the orignal strip, not so much when repeated 30,000 times)

name: apocowarg
text: I try to keep this kind of thing to a minimum and in retrospect this quote was forced into the thread awkwardly. I would delete it if I could.

name: hawaiian_robot
text:
Wow, I must've felt really bad about about calling you out, as apparently I gave you a chubby (in a non-gay way, not that there's anything wrong with that) 6 months ago.

Sorry again for lashing out dude.

name: apocowarg
text: There's no need to apologize for expressing an opinion that has a good deal of merit in a polite fashion.

name: os
text: This place is the best place to internet with other people.

name: jimmywales
text: apocowarg got lameded for quoting achewood, but up there katal got chubbed up the wazzoo for quoting the title of this very achewood strip. Assetbar is a harsh and fickle mistress.

name: killerlimpet
text: I think it depends on the context. Quoting a comic in an unexpected but funny way can be good. Saying "...boned?" is funny once or twice is okay but quickly becomes tedious.

name: hawaiian_robot
text: Exactly .

name: laserblade
text: Yeah, some Achewood-quoting I've seen around here is beyond inspired.

name: dusty
text: Just to be clear, it's still funny if we fit a good quote in where it's an actual response and not just triggered by a word like a Google ad, right?

name: soticoto
text:
Too true...

Though in my particular case, sometimes I like to quote things out of context just to wind people up, cos I'm a bit of a cunt like that.
I try to keep it to a minimum these days, mind you.

Thing is though... things round here are so patterned that you can mostly tell how things are going to be reacted to before you post them... so winding folks up is... quite easy. ^_^

name: blitztrug
text: all i read: "I'm a bit of a cunt"

name: jimmywales
text: All soticoto comments are basically that, rephrased.

name: radarjammer
text: With five words, you exposed much stupidness. Thank you. Few can say as much.

name: tekende
text: A comment left by tekende was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by InfiniteJest, instantkarma, mercuri0us, Semiquaver, Wulvaine, achilleselbow, Doc_Rostov, stormagnet, morbo)

name: tekende
text: Why the hell did I find it necessary to post this five months ago?

name: semiquaver
text:
Because posting it four months ago would have been terrible .

Incidentally the lames were for hating this country and also for hating the world and poor people and animals.

name: tekende
text: So if I say I'm not a liberal, 8 (right now) people immediately jump to the conclusion that I'm a hateful person who hates " the world and poor people and animals"? Interesting, considering I never said here what I actually am.

name: sweetlips
text:
Oh shit dude, you hate those things, I'm going to lame you so hard.

But not really, animals can get on my nerves too.

name: semiquaver
text: calm down dude.  sarcasm is possible on the big bad cyberwub.

name: radarjammer
text: Wow. GOP haters round here much?

name: jimbob
text: Or Cure haters?

name: mashisoyo
text: Or both?

name: libelandslander
text: I am actually genuinely curious why people hear "not liberal" and assume "oh noez republican."

name: soticoto
text: We don't even freakin HAVE republicans over here in Britain. We gots Tories instead.

name: lexsenthur
text: What would my father say?!?

name: ssddr
text: Any strip ripping on the cure is 5 to me.

name: dovey
text: They're such a silly band

name: stuart
text: It is silly to like The Cure

name: mastronaut
text: I'm a silly, silly bastard.

name: bjorntd
text: It is impossible to like the Cure. It is possible to hate yourself.

name: biddlebubbly
text: Luckily you don't have to like the cure if you're a liberal. It's like a square is always a rectangle but a rectangle isn't necessarily a square deal.

name: trollcollins
text: [IMGS OFF]Sorry for the MS Paint shittiness. My computer is antediluvian.

name: catgrl131
text: Heh. More like [IMGS OFF]

name: trollcollins
text: Improved to reflect new census data!

name: i_love_kate
text:
Possibly the only exchange to have improved due to [IMGS OFF]

Except everything posted by AIU or Manflesh, of course.

name: aaron_haynes
text: A comment left by aaron_haynes was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by radarjammer, uberbee, I_Love_Kate)

name: spinynorman
text: Also in music.

name: heccibiggs
text: Ooooohhhhhhhh

name: relaxing
text: Ringo Starr is the longest-running joke in music.

name: yomimono
text: If it weren't for Ringo Starr and his five-note range I would have nothing to sing on karaoke night.

name: mashisoyo
text: No.

name: centipede_damascus
text: I'd take three hundred bucks to be someone's vice president.

name: wae
text: with that kind of money, you could definitely step on half an instrument.

name: connellingus
text: The way Ray throws Téodor's "I can't hear you, I got bubbles popping all around me" excuse back at him is brilliant.

name: andrewthepig
text:
It would appear that popping bubbles is a constant interference to conversations between Ray and Teodor.

Listen to you, Mr. Learning Head.

name: jesler729
text: I think this is the first look into Ray's political affiliation.

name: dovey
text: Go back one strip. It's Lazarus' politics. I get the feeling Ray doesn't vote.

name: jesler729
text: Ah, I didn't notice that. You're probably right.

name: clockworkorange
text: "you dope" doesn't seem like strong enough language for Achewood.

name: unfun
text: It just happened to be the perfect word for Ray at the time.

name: meepmeep
text: A comment left by meepmeep was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by incredibledeath, Overmedicated, NigelChaos)

name: tronwell
text:
now i'm no expert, but near as i can tell this is pretty indicative of what they've done to us:
[IMGS OFF]
[IMGS OFF]

name: homepie
text:
my god

How do you get hair like that, I mean does it just happen that way

name: boscostacy
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: fermatprime
text: This is best comment.

name: tellumo
text: I think the dude has a tanker truck of Aqua Net in his concert rider.

name: charchar
text: Hairspray upside-down every day for twenty years.  Your life will change.

name: sp1derbaby
text: Backcombing. Don't ask me how I know. Let's just say I'm a little... silly.

name: greenkoolayd
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: aliiis
text: My hair actually does happen pretty much that way if I wash it and do not condition or brush it, it is a worrying thing.

name: tekende
text:
I have done this to my hair. I mean, sort of. The thing is, Robert Smith actually has very little hair to speak of, it is mostly plugs at this point, which is a large part of why it looks so horrible in that picture.

Anyway my point is that it is a difficult thing to do to your hair. It would take me anywhere from 30 minutes to an hour each time I did it.

name: semiquaver
text: This is so... yes .

name: wotown
text: Shoe money tonight.

name: wulvaine
text: You are Chris Crocker, and I claim my five pounds.

name: erutangis
text: Now I'm upset that my username isn't "Mister Learning-Head".

name: king-jim
text: You can't mess with Lovecats. Even if Robert Smith is a fat goth.

name: dallovich
text: Damn T knows his way around the amendments! Stone cold quoting of the top of his head!

name: history
text: In this time through the archives, I just realized, Ray is getting Theodore back in the second panel for his comment from an earlier strip.  The one where Ray asks Theodore to be the VP.

name: tttt2
text: why is lazarus conservative and supporting stem cell research

name: rasalghul
text:
Wow, Ray plays on some lush greens compared to T. And Ray is so casual about the conversation, it's like he's prepared for it, while T has to stop his game to talk to Ray.

The whole world is a game to Ray, and everyone but him is merely a player.

name: dtuba
text: Bravo sir. For noticing the turf inequality pictured therein.

name: puguglypress
text: He paid Teodor the maximum amount one can withdraw from an ATM on a whim.
